job_description: description position at veterinary cancer group sfv veterinary cancer group sfv is hiring a veterinary aide to join our amazing team the veterinary aide works closely with the veterinary technicians the veterinary aide must be able to follow direction quickly and handle animals in a variety of situations  essential responsibilities prepares and maintain cleanliness of entire hospital exam rooms treatment area cages and runs stocks and restocks entire hospital throughout the day adding items to inventory request list as needed assist doctors and technicians in restraint and treatment of patients escorts clients and patients to from waiting rooms lobby and back area take and record appropriate weights obtain the current patient chart and drop off form when necessary set up for procedures such as bone marrow aspirates catheters and fine needle aspirations administer oral medications sc injections and sc fluids be able to prepare and run in house lab tests including vch pcv and vet test in house chemistry analyzer clean and sterilize instruments as needed including maintenance of the cold sterile tray assist in running ekgs place all dogs and cats on towels with water as directed  litter pans for cats not needing urine collection and identified by cage cards learn the hazardous waste disposal procedures including chemo sharps and pharmaceutical waste walk dogs every 4 6 hours change and sanitize litter pans water feed as directed put away the laundry prepares saline flush in advance for chemotherapy administration take patient histories and start the computer record release patients to owner with direction of techs or doctor assists front desk as needed administer im injections do routine procedures such as draw blood and collect urine enter charges and calculations into computer competent taking x rays prepare and send out outside lab tests including blood urine and cultures able to start forms for histopathologies and cytologies able to take an accurate tpr able to handle and restrain fractious or aggressive animals able to take accurate phone messages relay information from doctors or techs to clients over the phone comfortable monitoring and reporting on stable admitted patients perform other duties as assigned apply today we look forward to hearing from you

work on saturdays and sundays comfortable with dogs and cats of all breeds and sizes ability to appropriately  safely restrain when necessary fractious pets able to lift 50 lbs and stand for long veterinary assistant careers at banfield pet hospital  for those who want to put their love of pets into action there are few jobs more rewarding than that of vet assistant while working closely with other pet health care professionals at banfield you’ll have the chance to advocate for pets and educate clients on all aspects of pet health in addition if your goal is to advance in your career you’ll have access to a variety of learning and development opportunities along the way  job description summary the veterinary assistant is a key member of the hospital team who supports and assists the veterinarians and veterinary technicians ensuring the safety of pets clients and other associates and the continuity of quality veterinary care  preferred education licenses certificate of completion from a navta approved veterinary assistant program or the equivalent combination of education training and experience that provides the required knowledge skills and abilities high school diploma or equivalent preferred  preferred experience must be able to perform all required skills of navta approved veterinary assistant programs at a level that aids in the efficiency of the practice   a day in the life of a banfield veterinary assistant the vet assistant provides professional efficient and exceptional service at all times making sure that clients and pets are comfortable in the hospital you will use your technical skills on a daily basis within state practice acts and as outlined in the navta guidelines for veterinary assistant skills and duties other responsibilities include  helping maintain the flow of patients   communicating with the veterinarian and vet techs   carrying out or setting up procedures that do not require veterinarian or vet tech assistance   adhering to hospital standards that keep pets safe and the treatment areas exam rooms and labs clean and organized   educating clients about our optimum wellness plans® and the importance of preventive care   mentoring other members of the hospital team commitment beyond qualifications every associate including the vet assistant has an important contribution to make to the veterinary team we’re looking for vet assistants who are dedicated to their work have a positive attitude and use our five principles  quality responsibility mutuality efficiency and freedom – as their guide in addition our vet assistants are  action oriented   customer focused   good listeners   effective communicators caring for those who care benefits for a banfield veterinary assistant when it comes to benefits we support your personal wellness and professional development we offer a wide range of perks and programs that help you take care of yourself and your family—including your pets   personal health savings and wellness benefits every team member needs to be appreciated all vet assistants receive a generous benefits package including 401 k participation paid time off and optimum wellness plans for your pets in addition medical vision dental life and disability insurance is offered to associates based on eligibility   potential as big as your passion whether you’re a new vet assistant have been working for years or are changing careers we’ll support your professional growth with  performance development plans designed to help you reach your established careers goals  relevant learning opportunities   networking events   ways to offer your skills to your community a support structure that helps you thrive we’ve created a one of a kind leadership structure throughout our practice that includes support from our corporate headquarters the field and hospital level together we are a team making a real impact on pet health care in hospitals communities and the field of veterinary medicine   start your banfield career as a veterinary assistant learn more about the impact you can make as part of a banfield hospital team and see how we support the wellness of our people and profession  view the full job description or if you’re ready to make your move apply today  banfield pet hospital® strongly supports and values the uniqueness of all individuals and promotes a work environment where diversity is embraced banfield pet hospital is an equal opportunity employer all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race religion color national origin sex sexual orientation gender identity age genetic information status as a protected veteran or status as a qualified individual with disability banfield pet hospital complies with all applicable federal state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every banfield location

overview we are hiring for an exam room team member are you a compassionate and hard working individual that loves working with animals and people? are you looking for an exciting career that provides the chance to help families provide the best care for their furry loved ones? apply today to join our team as an exam room assistant animal hospital of north asheville cares deeply about people and their pets our goal is to provide a fear free experience for our patients you will be an important part of improving the lives of pets and the people who love them  an exam room assistant must love working closely with people and animals each veterinarian exam room assistant team works together on a daily basis and becomes familiar with their patients and clients this is a very exciting and fast paced job that is perfect for an individual who is detail oriented patient able to communicate well and loves the human animal bond applicants should have prior experience in providing customer service we will be training you in the specialized gentle handling techniques used at this practice  an exam room team member must be able to multitask while paying attention to details duties also include but not limited to obtaining a complete medical history and entering it into the computerized medical chart discussing and recommending medical treatment options giving an estimate of cost and most importantly educating the clients about preventive wellness care assisting doctors with gentle low stress restraint during physical exams and procedures is a must  responsibilities position overview the veterinary assistant provides support to the veterinarians and technicians in their daily tasks by cleaning and maintaining equipment feeding exercising and grooming patients preparing and sanitizing surgery suites restraining and handling patients and clerical and administrative work they deliver quality care for all patients and provide exceptional service  tasks include triage patients perform physical exams treatments and administer medication as directed by the licensed veterinary technicians maintain accurate medical records assist doctors and technicians with the administration of medications or with patient restraint perform laboratory tests and take radiographs operate and maintain hospital equipment including ekg fluid pump syringe pump scales anesthetic monitors and machines etc fill prescriptions calculate and administer medications maintain proper documentation logging and security of controlled drugs feed patients as prescribed by the attending doctor or as the client has requested record appetites recognize and report any unusual conditions or abnormal behaviors maintain the cleanliness of the hospital each day clean equipment kennels and facilities using chemicals and supplies ensure the safe use of chemicals complete laundry other duties may be assigned if working in a specialty area i e  dentistry surgery emergency radiology cardiology neurology internal medicine etc  qualifications minimum qualifications requirements high school diploma ged or equivalent combination of education and or experience one or more years experience in veterinary environment performing above duties able to perform moderately physically demanding work that requires a lot of lifting up to 50 pounds  cleaning and constant motion ability to work with or around sick animals potentially hazardous materials cleaning chemicals gas anesthetics zoonotic diseases and unpleasant odors requires knowledge of hospital procedures treatment protocols computer systems and terminology used in a veterinary hospital must be flexible with scheduling and able to work some weekends and holidays  how to apply benefits health care plan options we offer a variety of plans individual and family retirement plan 401k life insurance long and short term disability options available paid time off vacation  public holidays uniform allowance discounted veterinary care continuing education along with becoming and maintaining fear free certification hands on training best of all working with a compassionate team dedicated to making the lives better for our patients and their families please send a cover letter with your animal handling experience and why you are interested in this job please use the link to apply online

veterinary assistant careers at banfield pet hospital  for those who want to put their love of pets into action there are few jobs more rewarding than that of vet assistant while working closely with other pet health care professionals at banfield you’ll have the chance to advocate for pets and educate clients on all aspects of pet health in addition if your goal is to advance in your career you’ll have access to a variety of learning and development opportunities along the way  job description summary the veterinary assistant is a key member of the hospital team who supports and assists the veterinarians and veterinary technicians ensuring the safety of pets clients and other associates and the continuity of quality veterinary care  preferred education licenses certificate of completion from a navta approved veterinary assistant program or the equivalent combination of education training and experience that provides the required knowledge skills and abilities high school diploma or equivalent preferred  preferred experience must be able to perform all required skills of navta approved veterinary assistant programs at a level that aids in the efficiency of the practice   a day in the life of a banfield veterinary assistant the vet assistant provides professional efficient and exceptional service at all times making sure that clients and pets are comfortable in the hospital you will use your technical skills on a daily basis within state practice acts and as outlined in the navta guidelines for veterinary assistant skills and duties other responsibilities include  helping maintain the flow of patients   communicating with the veterinarian and vet techs   carrying out or setting up procedures that do not require veterinarian or vet tech assistance   adhering to hospital standards that keep pets safe and the treatment areas exam rooms and labs clean and organized   educating clients about our optimum wellness plans® and the importance of preventive care   mentoring other members of the hospital team commitment beyond qualifications every associate including the vet assistant has an important contribution to make to the veterinary team we’re looking for vet assistants who are dedicated to their work have a positive attitude and use our five principles  quality responsibility mutuality efficiency and freedom – as their guide in addition our vet assistants are  action oriented   customer focused   good listeners   effective communicators caring for those who care benefits for a banfield veterinary assistant when it comes to benefits we support your personal wellness and professional development we offer a wide range of perks and programs that help you take care of yourself and your family—including your pets   personal health savings and wellness benefits every team member needs to be appreciated all vet assistants receive a generous benefits package including 401 k participation paid time off and optimum wellness plans for your pets in addition medical vision dental life and disability insurance is offered to associates based on eligibility   potential as big as your passion whether you’re a new vet assistant have been working for years or are changing careers we’ll support your professional growth with  performance development plans designed to help you reach your established careers goals  relevant learning opportunities   networking events   ways to offer your skills to your community a support structure that helps you thrive we’ve created a one of a kind leadership structure throughout our practice that includes support from our corporate headquarters the field and hospital level together we are a team making a real impact on pet health care in hospitals communities and the field of veterinary medicine   start your banfield career as a veterinary assistant learn more about the impact you can make as part of a banfield hospital team and see how we support the wellness of our people and profession  view the full job description or if you’re ready to make your move apply today  banfield pet hospital® strongly supports and values the uniqueness of all individuals and promotes a work environment where diversity is embraced banfield pet hospital is an equal opportunity employer all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race religion color national origin sex sexual orientation gender identity age genetic information status as a protected veteran or status as a qualified individual with disability banfield pet hospital complies with all applicable federal state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every banfield location

bluepearl veterinary partners is hiring an er veterinary assistant in north seattle bluepearl veterinary partners in north seattle is seeking an experienced veterinary assistant to join our talented er team we are looking for someone who has previous experience to work in a dynamic multi doctor practice this is a full time opportunity working thursday  saturday from 7 am to 5 pm 30 hours scheduled  we are also open to a wed sat 7 am to 5 pm schedule if preferred  if you answered “yes” to these questions we want to hear from you as an assistant you will be responsible for triaging incoming emergencies obtaining vitals and patient history and relaying this information to the doctor you will complete treatment orders from the doctor and either discharge or admit patients to our icu you will complete treatments on inpatients and monitor their status communicating any changes or concerns to the doctor blood draws ivc placement restraint and taking radiographs are examples of skills that are essential and used daily in this position      hospital support  hospital paraprofessional staff  regular  washington seattle 150031 seattle wa  150031 seattle wa

veterinary technician banfield aspires to be a practice where as a team we make a positive impact on pet health care in hospitals communities and the field of veterinary medicine and we believe hiring people with diverse perspectives ideas and cultures permits us to deliver to the highest quality of preventive care  as a banfield veterinary technician you will work alongside pet health care industry experts to make a difference in the lives of the pets and clients we serve with the chance to utilize your veterinary knowledge communication skills and love for pets this role will afford you the opportunity to define a clear career path for continued growth and learning    veterinary technician certification or licensure cvt rvt lvt or lvmt   being a veterinary technician requires much more than avma certified credentials it means bringing your talents skills dedication and a desire for developing alongside your peers but most importantly it means showing up each day with a passion for pets and working with others who believe preventive care is the key to helping pets achieve long and healthy lives  as we do with all our associates we look to our vet techs to adopt our five principles — quality responsibility mutuality efficiency and freedom and while your on paper qualifications are of course important we actively seek out vet techs who thrive on delivering outstanding client and pet experiences   we know that your real passion for pet well being is why you chose this profession at banfield we believe it is just as important to support the well being of those who devote their lives to this cause through our extensive network and support structure banfield offers a wide array of benefits and programs empowering you to focus on yourself and your family as you care for pets and clients as a banfield vet tech we want you to take full advantage of work and play through   whether you are a newly certified or an experienced vet tech a job at banfield opens the door to exploring the next best move in your career   we’ve created a structure that includes leadership and support at the hospital level in the field and at our headquarters all with one goal in mind helping you deliver quality care for all pets   through volunteering efforts and our programs designed to benefit local shelters and rescues we strengthen the pet human connections in our communities discover how we support the wellbeing of our people and profession through the mars volunteer program mvp   make your move and apply today banfield pet hospital® strongly supports and values the uniqueness of all individuals and promotes a work environment where diversity is embraced banfield pet hospital is an equal opportunity employer all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race religion color national origin sex sexual orientation gender identity age genetic information or protected veteran status if you have a disability veterinary assistant careers at banfield pet hospital  for those who want to put their love of pets into action there are few jobs more rewarding than that of vet assistant while working closely with other pet health care professionals at banfield you’ll have the chance to advocate for pets and educate clients on all aspects of pet health in addition if your goal is to advance in your career you’ll have access to a variety of learning and development opportunities along the way  job description summary the veterinary assistant is a key member of the hospital team who supports and assists the veterinarians and veterinary technicians ensuring the safety of pets clients and other associates and the continuity of quality veterinary care  preferred education licenses certificate of completion from a navta approved veterinary assistant program or the equivalent combination of education training and experience that provides the required knowledge skills and abilities high school diploma or equivalent preferred  preferred experience must be able to perform all required skills of navta approved veterinary assistant programs at a level that aids in the efficiency of the practice   a day in the life of a banfield veterinary assistant the vet assistant provides professional efficient and exceptional service at all times making sure that clients and pets are comfortable in the hospital you will use your technical skills on a daily basis within state practice acts and as outlined in the navta guidelines for veterinary assistant skills and duties other responsibilities include  helping maintain the flow of patients   communicating with the veterinarian and vet techs   carrying out or setting up procedures that do not require veterinarian or vet tech assistance   adhering to hospital standards that keep pets safe and the treatment areas exam rooms and labs clean and organized   educating clients about our optimum wellness plans® and the importance of preventive care   mentoring other members of the hospital team commitment beyond qualifications every associate including the vet assistant has an important contribution to make to the veterinary team we’re looking for vet assistants who are dedicated to their work have a positive attitude and use our five principles  quality responsibility mutuality efficiency and freedom – as their guide in addition our vet assistants are  action oriented   customer focused   good listeners   effective communicators caring for those who care benefits for a banfield veterinary assistant when it comes to benefits we support your personal wellness and professional development we offer a wide range of perks and programs that help you take care of yourself and your family—including your pets   personal health savings and wellness benefits every team member needs to be appreciated all vet assistants receive a generous benefits package including 401 k participation paid time off and optimum wellness plans for your pets in addition medical vision dental life and disability insurance is offered to associates based on eligibility   potential as big as your passion whether you’re a new vet assistant have been working for years or are changing careers we’ll support your professional growth with  performance development plans designed to help you reach your established careers goals  relevant learning opportunities   networking events   ways to offer your skills to your community a support structure that helps you thrive we’ve created a one of a kind leadership structure throughout our practice that includes support from our corporate headquarters the field and hospital level together we are a team making a real impact on pet health care in hospitals communities and the field of veterinary medicine   start your banfield career as a veterinary assistant learn more about the impact you can make as part of a banfield hospital team and see how we support the wellness of our people and profession  view the full job description or if you’re ready to make your move apply today  banfield pet hospital® strongly supports and values the uniqueness of all individuals and promotes a work environment where diversity is embraced banfield pet hospital is an equal opportunity employer all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race religion color national origin sex sexual orientation gender identity age genetic information status as a protected veteran or status as a qualified individual with disability banfield pet hospital complies with all applicable federal state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every banfield location

overview veterinary assistant at cumberland animal hospital  cumberland animal hospital is a progressive 3 doctor practice located some 30 miles east of nashville we pride ourselves on not only being the best veterinarians in town but on having the nicest facilities and providing the best experience for our pets and their people as a veterinary assistant you will be on the front lines of pet care and client service if you are a highly motivated person with a passion for helping people and their pets we would love to hear from you  responsibilities position overview the veterinary assistant provides support to the veterinarians and technicians in their daily tasks by cleaning and maintaining equipment feeding exercising and grooming patients preparing and sanitizing surgery suites restraining and handling patients and clerical and administrative work they deliver quality care for all patients and provide exceptional service  tasks include triage patients perform physical exams treatments and administer medication as directed by the licensed veterinary technicians maintain accurate medical records assist doctors and technicians with the administration of medications or with patient restraint perform laboratory tests and take radiographs operate and maintain hospital equipment including ekg fluid pump syringe pump scales anesthetic monitors and machines etc fill prescriptions calculate and administer medications maintain proper documentation logging and security of controlled drugs feed patients as prescribed by the attending doctor or as the client has requested record appetites recognize and report any unusual conditions or abnormal behaviors maintain the cleanliness of the hospital each day clean equipment kennels and facilities using chemicals and supplies ensure the safe use of chemicals complete laundry other duties may be assigned if working in a specialty area i e  dentistry surgery emergency radiology cardiology neurology internal medicine etc  qualifications minimum qualifications requirements high school diploma ged or equivalent combination of education and or experience one or more years experience in veterinary environment performing above duties able to perform moderately physically demanding work that requires a lot of lifting up to 50 pounds  cleaning and constant motion ability to work with or around sick animals potentially hazardous materials cleaning chemicals gas anesthetics zoonotic diseases and unpleasant odors requires knowledge of hospital procedures treatment protocols computer systems and terminology used in a veterinary hospital must be flexible with scheduling and able to work some weekends and holidays  how to apply please apply online through petvetcareers com

overview columbia river veterinary specialists is an emergency and specialty veterinary hospital in vancouver washington located just north of spectacular downtown portland oregon and on the northern bank of the columbia river we are a compassionate and enthusiastic group of professionals dedicated to a team approach to client and patient care our strength as a practice stems from our ability to collaborate and our devotion to the well being of the animals in our care we take time for every client who walks through our doors and care deeply for our patients we are proud of the work we do and we are appreciated by our managers co workers and the community  we are looking for experienced veterinary assistants to join our team we are interviewing for knowledgeable effortless leaders who share our passion for innovation in medicine continued education and warm personal client care  within our practice we rely on excellent communication skills between staff managers and clients as well as a positive and friendly attitude throughout the hospital at crvs specialists er doctors technicians assistants and receptionists all work together to provide exceptional care and treatment for all of our patients we value every member of our team and promote compassion and empathy as well as offering support and encouragement to peers we continuously work to support an environment of consensus and team building it is this emphasis on our core values paired with our unparalleled commitment to the optimal patient care that makes us the unified and compelling practice that we are  our hospital features a solid reputation among our clients as well as with the surrounding referring veterinary community our advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies are ready to assist you in providing patients the very best in care it is not an overstatement to say that crvs is great place to work for more information about our staff and clinic please visit our website at www columbiarivervet com we encourage our staff to achieve work life balance in the beautiful outdoor playground that is the pacific northwest the coast range cascade mountains high desert and wine country are all within driving distance and the hawaiian islands and mexico are a mere hop away  our ideal candidate will possess excellent communication skills a knack for setting clients at ease and a love of teamwork beyond professional qualifications a good candidate for us is defined by cultural fit we invite you to apply for this open position and an opportunity to visit and interview with us  at columbia river we take the health and well being of our employees seriously offering flexible working conditions and encouraging a well rounded work life balance we offer a great compensation package including a competitive salary health insurance 401k pto generous ce allowance additional pto for ce and reimbursement for membership and license fees if this sounds like a team you want to be a part of please apply at https www petvetcareers com  responsibilities position overview the veterinary assistant provides support to the veterinarians and technicians in their daily tasks by cleaning and maintaining equipment feeding exercising and grooming patients preparing and sanitizing surgery suites restraining and handling patients and clerical and administrative work they deliver quality care for all patients and provide exceptional service  tasks include triage patients perform physical exams treatments and administer medication as directed by the licensed veterinary technicians maintain accurate medical records assist doctors and technicians with the administration of medications or with patient restraint perform laboratory tests and take radiographs operate and maintain hospital equipment including ekg fluid pump syringe pump scales anesthetic monitors and machines etc fill prescriptions calculate and administer medications maintain proper documentation logging and security of controlled drugs feed patients as prescribed by the attending doctor or as the client has requested record appetites recognize and report any unusual conditions or abnormal behaviors maintain the cleanliness of the hospital each day clean equipment kennels and facilities using chemicals and supplies ensure the safe use of chemicals complete laundry other duties may be assigned if working in a specialty area i e  dentistry surgery emergency radiology cardiology neurology internal medicine etc  qualifications minimum qualifications requirements high school diploma ged or equivalent combination of education and or experience one or more years experience in veterinary environment performing above duties able to perform moderately physically demanding work that requires a lot of lifting up to 50 pounds  cleaning and constant motion ability to work with or around sick animals potentially hazardous materials cleaning chemicals gas anesthetics zoonotic diseases and unpleasant odors requires knowledge of hospital procedures treatment protocols computer systems and terminology used in a veterinary hospital must be flexible with scheduling and able to work some weekends and holidays  how to apply please apply online through petvetcareers com

veterinary technician banfield aspires to be a practice where as a team we make a positive impact on pet health care in hospitals communities and the field of veterinary medicine and we believe hiring people with diverse perspectives ideas and cultures permits us to deliver to the highest quality of preventive care  as a banfield veterinary technician you will work alongside pet health care industry experts to make a difference in the lives of the pets and clients we serve with the chance to utilize your veterinary knowledge communication skills and love for pets this role will afford you the opportunity to define a clear career path for continued growth and learning    veterinary technician certification or licensure cvt rvt lvt or lvmt   being a veterinary technician requires much more than avma certified credentials it means bringing your talents skills dedication and a desire for developing alongside your peers but most importantly it means showing up each day with a passion for pets and working with others who believe preventive care is the key to helping pets achieve long and healthy lives  as we do with all our associates we look to our vet techs to adopt our five principles — quality responsibility mutuality efficiency and freedom and while your on paper qualifications are of course important we actively seek out vet techs who thrive on delivering outstanding client and pet experiences   we know that your real passion for pet well being is why you chose this profession at banfield we believe it is just as important to support the well being of those who devote their lives to this cause through our extensive network and support structure banfield offers a wide array of benefits and programs empowering you to focus on yourself and your family as you care for pets and clients as a banfield vet tech we want you to take full advantage of work and play through   whether you are a newly certified or an experienced vet tech a job at banfield opens the door to exploring the next best move in your career   we’ve created a structure that includes leadership and support at the hospital level in the field and at our headquarters all with one goal in mind helping you deliver quality care for all pets   through volunteering efforts and our programs designed to benefit local shelters and rescues we strengthen the pet human connections in our communities discover how we support the wellbeing of our people and profession through the mars volunteer program mvp   make your move and apply today banfield pet hospital® strongly supports and values the uniqueness of all individuals and promotes a work environment where diversity is embraced banfield pet hospital is an equal opportunity employer all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race religion color national origin sex sexual orientation gender identity age genetic information or protected veteran status if you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation please let us know banfield pet hospital follows all applicable federal state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every banfield location

bluepearl veterinary partners in houston tx is hiring an exceptional veterinary technician – surgery – vet tech this will be for our new location in the greenway plaza area  are you a driven dependable committed and knowledgeable? do you demonstrates excellent interpersonal skills in a team atmosphere? do you want to be in a dynamic and rewarding setting? surgery technicians should be comfortable handling sedation and basic to advanced anesthesia cases they should be capable of taking x rays at an intermediate level you should have experience in a specialty or surgical center has a minimum of two years experience with administering monitoring anesthesia is comfortable working with a mechanical ventilator is comfortable with anesthesia asa level i iii cases has experience taking appropriate orthopedic radiographs has open availability during weekday business hours    the primary function of the surgery veterinary technician is to be responsible for treatments of stable hospitalized patients and stable outpatient diagnostics and treatments provides nursing care to stable patients according to hospital standards of care and core values ability to place peripheral intravenous catheter in cephalic vein performs physical exam accurately counts heart pulse rate capillary refill time mucous membranes temperature respiratory rate and effort understands normal vital parameters and alerts doctor when abnormal able to set up intravenous fluids administers subcutaneous fluids can operate all brands of intravenous fluid pumps and can troubleshoot errors able to disconnect and connect patient from intravenous fluids aseptically ability to monitor patient response to fluid therapy including signs of overload who are we? description position at veterinary specialty center of seattle the veterinary specialty center of seattle is hiring veterinary technician assistants to join our amazing team if you are a visionary who wants to use your technical skills if you are dedicated to gold standard veterinary care if you want to grow and be challenged beyond your current role then veterinary specialty center of seattle is the place for you to shine ideal candidate has 1 year of clinical veterinary experience as a veterinary assistant has a positive work attitude and commitment to a stress free environment for our patients has schedule flexibility available to work nights weekends and holidays is able to work in a fast paced environment provides excellent patient care and customer service possesses excellent restraint skills is comfortable working with computer software to complete patient records and treatment knowledge of ezyvet and smart flow a plus why work at the veterinary specialty center of seattle vscs ? vscs is a 24 hour emergency critical care and specialty hospital that offers a collaborative approach to veterinary medicine we support emergency and critical care neurology surgery internal medicine cardiology oncology and radiology all in one hospital at vscs we practice progressive medicine in a state of the art facility that houses ct mri interventional radiology endoscopy echocardiology chemotherapeutic services stem cell therapy acupuncture and more we pride ourselves on providing compassionate medical care and exceptional client service  we promote an emotionally intelligent work environment and a positive work life balance we invest heavily in our employees with many opportunities for growth and development we offer outstanding benefits including medical dental vision and life insurance paid time off continuing education generous pet discounts and much more the seattle area offers many opportunities for nature lovers outdoor enthusiasts and city dwellers being a part of the pacific northwest the area offers beautiful hiking kayaking nature walks and beaches in the summer skiing snowshoeing and other winter sports are extremely popular the seattle area also boasts some of the best culinary experiences in the country you can find top notch theater ballet opera and an ever growing music scene with year round festivals fairs and concert venues there is always something to do  looking to utilize and advance your skills as a veterinary assistant apply today we look forward to hearing from you

veterinary assistant careers at banfield pet hospital  for those who want to put their love of pets into action there are few jobs more rewarding than that of vet assistant while working closely with other pet health care professionals at banfield you’ll have the chance to advocate for pets and educate clients on all aspects of pet health in addition if your goal is to advance in your career you’ll have access to a variety of learning and development opportunities along the way  job description summary the veterinary assistant is a key member of the hospital team who supports and assists the veterinarians and veterinary technicians ensuring the safety of pets clients and other associates and the continuity of quality veterinary care  preferred education licenses certificate of completion from a navta approved veterinary assistant program or the equivalent combination of education training and experience that provides the required knowledge skills and abilities high school diploma or equivalent preferred  preferred experience must be able to perform all required skills of navta approved veterinary assistant programs at a level that aids in the efficiency of the practice   desired skills and experience a day in the life of a banfield veterinary assistant the vet assistant provides professional efficient and exceptional service at all times making sure that clients and healthier pets happier people better world our vision might sound lofty but we believe it’s attainable when we obsess about providing complete care for our amazing pets our approach goes far beyond addressing our animals’ basic needs to support their physical mental social and emotional needs by being sure we take all of these elements into consideration we can help pet parents take the very best care of their pets  our obsession with delivering the very best experiences for pets and their parents guides all we do from our convenient affordable pet salon services to our extensive array of training classes and workshops we always make sure to keep our commitment to healthy happy pets front and center   we are seeking partners for our full service hospitals these brand new general practice hospitals will be located inside our petco stores the purpose of this position inherently involves providing excellent medical care to our full service hospital patients and phenomenal customer care to their owners the veterinary assistant represents the mission and values to all clients  our veterinary assistant sets the tone within the technical and customer support staff in the hospital and is responsible like all team members for fostering cohesion and motivation within the team   all hospital staff are responsible for performing their duties in a way that creates an environment in which the incumbent must be able to consistently perform all of the following duties and responsibilities with or without a reasonable accommodation  this position has no immediate supervisory duties   the majority of job duties are conducted in the veterinary hospital position requires bending kneeling lifting up to 30 pounds as necessary and standing for long periods of time   a large amount of this partner’s time will be spent in direct contact with clients and their pets   no minimum

because we’re obsessed with the health of pets we offer a variety of vet services to meet the needs of our customers which means a wealth of career opportunities whether you’re a licensed veterinarian or a veterinarian support professional located inside petco stores our vetco wellness centers offer professional expertise for common pet health problems  our vetco vaccination clinics offer a variety of preventive care services for healthy dogs and cats inside petco and unleashed by petco retail stores across the us rather than having a permanent presence these clinics function like pop ups inside petco stores our crew and veterinarian arrive at the store with the equipment vaccines medications and everything else they need to take care of the pets they see   as a vetco veterinary assistant you will meet your veterinary team at our local dispatch office then travel to your assigned petco clinic locations for the day at the clinics your team of veterinary assistants will greet the pet parents and recommend the veterinary services that will best protect their pets the veterinary assistant will assist the veterinarian so the services can be administered and thank the pet parent for protecting their pet    no minimum

description position at bloom animal hospital bloom animal hospital and the allergy skin and ear clinic for pets is looking for an experienced and passionate full time veterinary technician to join their amazing team the ideal candidate is  the veterinary technicians in this practice are regarded as important professionals who help deliver excellent patient care our practice is dermatology focused and we also have a general practice unit we are looking for an individual who desires to deliver the best available veterinary care in a fear free setting the ideal candidate is licensed but other candidates with a strong veterinary medical background and the desire to succeed will be considered   bloom animal hospital and the allergy skin and ear clinic for pets is a specialty dermatology and general medicine practice located in livonia mi in addition to being aaha accredited for over 30 years our staff is fear free certified and we are a member of the aafp our typical technician schedule is 3 4 days a week and we are always closed on wednesdays we offer an incredible benefits package that includes health dental vision life 401k paid time off and significant pet benefits we also offer paid continuing education fear free certification and a uniform allowance this job is for the individual who is passionate about pets and exceptional veterinary care wants to be at the top of their field and is willing to work hard to achieve that goal

description position at the pet hospitals midtown  the pet hospitals midtown is looking for a veterinary assistant to join our growing team applicants must be able to travel between locations excel in client satisfaction  compassion have a friendly  outgoing personality thrive in a fast paced environment and respond to challenges positively be punctual and have weekend availability not be afraid of hard work and getting dirty as a veterinary assistant you will assist veterinarians in providing care for animals including appointments surgeries supportive care and diagnostics educate clients on services and patient care help maintain hospital cleanliness be able to safely restrain various sized dogs and cats why work for the pet hospitals? did you know that you can have a fulfilling career working with pets? we invest heavily in our employees long term growth and happiness the pet hospitals has 7 locations throughout memphis with a team of 30 doctors but the way we treat the pet parent at the other end of the leash is what really makes us stand out not only do all team members love animals of all different breeds sizes and types they also have a passion for providing exceptional customer service  our employee benefits include competitive pay medical dental vision and supplemental insurance 401k with no waiting period paid time off paid parental leave employee pet discounts think this is up your alley? apply today apply today we look forward to hearing from you

veterinary technician banfield aspires to be a practice where as a team we make a positive impact on pet health care in hospitals communities and the field of veterinary medicine and we believe hiring people with diverse perspectives ideas and cultures permits us to deliver to the highest quality of preventive care  as a banfield veterinary technician you will work alongside pet health care industry experts to make a difference in the lives of the pets and clients we serve with the chance to utilize your veterinary knowledge communication skills and love for pets this role will afford you the opportunity to define a clear career path for continued growth and learning    veterinary technician certification or licensure cvt rvt lvt or lvmt  cb  being a veterinary technician requires much more than avma certified credentials it means bringing your talents skills dedication and a desire for developing alongside your peers but most importantly it means showing up each day with a passion for pets and working with others who believe preventive care is the key to helping pets achieve long and healthy lives  as we do with all our associates we look to our vet techs to adopt our five principles — quality responsibility mutuality efficiency and freedom and while your on paper qualifications are of course important we actively seek out vet techs who thrive on delivering outstanding client and pet experiences   we know that your real passion for pet well being is why you chose this profession at banfield we believe it is just as important to support the well being of those who devote their lives to this cause through our extensive network and support structure banfield offers a wide array of benefits and programs empowering you to focus on yourself and your family as you care for pets and clients as a banfield vet tech we want you to take full advantage of work and play through   whether you are a newly certified or an experienced vet tech a job at banfield opens the door to exploring the next best move in your career   we’ve created a structure that includes leadership and support at the hospital level in the field and at our headquarters all with one goal in mind helping you deliver quality care for all pets   through volunteering efforts and our programs designed to benefit local shelters and rescues we strengthen the pet human connections in our communities discover how we support the wellbeing of our people and profession through the mars volunteer program mvp   make your move and apply today banfield pet hospital® strongly supports and values the uniqueness of all individuals and promotes a work environment where diversity is embraced banfield pet hospital is an equal opportunity employer all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race religion color national origin sex sexual orientation gender identity age genetic information or protected veteran status if you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation please let us know banfield pet hospital follows all applicable federal state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every banfield location

description position at access advance critical care emergency and specialty services culver city access los angeles is hiring veterinary technicians to join our amazing team our internal medicine department is looking for professional ambitious self motivated technicians who look forward to fast paced days and enjoy being a key player on a dynamic team providing the highest standard of patient care our ideal candidate would have a strong personal desire to be the best in their field and an established record of performance with a  if other services function as the heart of the hospital internal medicine works as the brain  each day presents endless learning opportunities and a chance to make a real difference for our patients and clients  we treat endocrine immunologic and infectious diseases as well as conditions of the respiratory urinary and gastrointestinal systems we use the latest technology to diagnose and treat our patients including digital radiology ultrasonography fluoroscopy and ct our veterinary technicians perform anesthesia and assist for core internal medicine procedures such as bronchoscopy gastrointestinal endoscopy rhinoscopy cystoscopy bone marrow and liver biopsy as well as more advanced procedures such as tracheal and urethral stenting laser lithotripsy ectopic ureteral ablation and other applications of interventional radiology  in addition to all the benefits youd expect pto health medical dental insurance etc  we also offer continuing education benefits scholarships support for obtaining vts in house ce provided by our board certified specialists and regional director of education  development and infinite opportunity for development and growth both personally and professionally and more

veterinary assistant careers at banfield pet hospital  for those who want to put their love of pets into action there are few jobs more rewarding than that of vet assistant while working closely with other pet health care professionals at banfield you’ll have the chance to advocate for pets and educate clients on all aspects of pet health in addition if your goal is to advance in your career you’ll have access to a variety of learning and development opportunities along the way  job description summary the veterinary assistant is a key member of the hospital team who supports and assists the veterinarians and veterinary technicians ensuring the safety of pets clients and other associates and the continuity of quality veterinary care  preferred education licenses certificate of completion from a navta approved veterinary assistant program or the equivalent combination of education training and experience that provides the required knowledge skills and abilities high school diploma or equivalent preferred  preferred experience must be able to perform all required skills of navta approved veterinary assistant programs at a level that aids in the efficiency of the practice   desired skills and experience a day in the life of a banfield veterinary assistant the vet assistant provides professional efficient and exceptional service at all times making sure that clients and pets are comfortable in the hospital you will use your technical skills on a daily basis within state practice acts and as outlined in the navta guidelines for veterinary assistant skills and duties other responsibilities include  helping maintain the flow of patients   communicating with the veterinarian and vet techs   carrying out or setting up procedures that do not require veterinarian or vet tech assistance   adhering to hospital standards that keep pets safe and the treatment areas exam rooms and labs clean and organized   educating clients about our optimum wellness plans® and the importance of preventive care   mentoring other members of the hospital team commitment beyond qualifications every associate including the vet assistant has an important contribution to make to the veterinary team we’re looking for vet assistants who are dedicated to their work have a positive attitude and use our five principles  quality responsibility mutuality efficiency and freedom – as their guide in addition our vet assistants are  action oriented   customer focused   good listeners   effective communicators caring for those who care benefits for a banfield veterinary assistant when it comes to benefits we support your personal wellness and professional development we offer a wide range of perks and programs that help you take care of yourself and your family—including your pets   personal health savings and wellness benefits every team member needs to be appreciated all vet assistants receive a generous benefits package including 401 k participation paid time off and optimum wellness plans for your pets in addition medical vision dental life and disability insurance is offered to associates based on eligibility   potential as big as your passion whether you’re a new vet assistant have been working for years or are changing careers we’ll support your professional growth with  performance development plans designed to help you reach your established careers goals  relevant learning opportunities   networking events   ways to offer your skills to your community a support structure that helps you thrive we’ve created a one of a kind leadership structure throughout our practice that includes support from our corporate headquarters the field and hospital level together we are a team making a real impact on pet health care in hospitals communities and the field of veterinary medicine   start your banfield career as a veterinary assistant learn more about the impact you can make as part of a banfield hospital team and see how we support the wellness of our people and profession  view the full job description or if you’re ready to make your move apply today  banfield pet hospital® strongly supports and values the uniqueness of all individuals and promotes a work environment where diversity is embraced banfield pet hospital is an equal opportunity employer all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race religion color national origin sex sexual orientation gender identity age genetic information status as a protected veteran or status as a qualified individual with disability banfield pet hospital complies with all applicable federal state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every banfield location

veterinary technician banfield aspires to be a practice where as a team we make a positive impact on pet health care in hospitals communities and the field of veterinary medicine and we believe hiring people with diverse perspectives ideas and cultures permits us to deliver to the highest quality of preventive care  as a banfield veterinary technician you will work alongside pet health care industry experts to make a difference in the lives of the pets and clients we serve with the chance to utilize your veterinary knowledge communication skills and love for pets this role will afford you the opportunity to define a clear career path for continued growth and learning    veterinary technician certification or licensure cvt rvt lvt or lvmt   being a veterinary technician requires much more than avma certified credentials it means bringing your talents skills dedication and a desire for developing alongside your peers but most importantly it means showing up each day with a passion for pets and working with others who believe preventive care is the key to helping pets achieve long and healthy lives  as we do with all our associates we look to our vet techs to adopt our five principles — quality responsibility mutuality efficiency and freedom and while your on paper qualifications are of course important we actively seek out vet techs who thrive on delivering outstanding client and pet experiences   we know that your real passion for pet well being is why you chose this profession at banfield we believe it is just as important to support the well being of those who devote their lives to this cause through our extensive network and support structure banfield offers a wide array of benefits and programs empowering you to focus on yourself and your family as you care for pets and clients as a banfield vet tech we want you to take full advantage of work and play through   whether you are a newly certified or an experienced vet tech a job at banfield opens the door to exploring the next best move in your career   we’ve created a structure that includes leadership and support at the hospital level in the field and at our headquarters all with one goal in mind helping you deliver quality care for all pets   through volunteering efforts and our programs designed to benefit local shelters and rescues we strengthen the pet human connections in our communities discover how we support the wellbeing of our people and profession through the mars volunteer program mvp   make your move and apply today banfield pet hospital® strongly supports and values the uniqueness of all individuals and promotes a work environment where diversity is embraced banfield pet hospital is an equal opportunity employer all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race religion color national origin sex sexual orientation gender identity age genetic information or protected veteran status if you have a disability bluepearl veterinary partners is hiring an exceptional veterinary assistant to join our team  are you looking to advance your career as a veterinary technician?  do you have a strong passion for the veterinary field?  do you want to work with dedicated highly skilled veterinary professionals? if you answered yes to these questions then we want to hear from you desired skills and experience in this role • you observe patients for obvious signs of health concerns and report any findings to senior staff  • you will clean and disinfect areas of the hospital as often as is necessary to maintain high standards of care  • you prepare patient meals clean patient cages and bedding and maintain litter boxes  • you will safely approach and restrain cooperative patients as needed during treatments  • you will provide routine attention to patients including walking dogs  • you can effectively clean and maintain hospital equipment and tools  • you will quantify patient voids and report findings to senior veterinary assistant or technician  • you will remove and wash soiled laundry and keep clean laundry stocked  • you will patrol facility regularly to ensure cleanliness • you will complete daily checklists as set up by your supervisor   qualifications  high school diploma  an interest in pursuing a career in veterinary medicine what can you expect from bluepearl? bluepearl veterinary partners grew from the dreams of numerous veterinarians who believed pets should have access to high quality groundbreaking healthcare we are seeking hospital support with the same philosophy who are looking to grow their career in an exciting environment with a family atmosphere how you can become successful at bluepearl? at bluepearl the continued education of our techs is paramount not only do our techs get to work in state of the art facilities with the best veterinary teams in the nation but they also have access 90 paid scholarships with penn foster and ce allowances we also go even further to hold monthly ce meetings associate feedback sessions and opportunities for mentorship and cross training your benefit options will include  health benefits options  competitive compensation  flexible hours  scrub allowance  opportunity to bring your dog to work  additional training  unlimited growth potential like us on facebook to learn about bluepearl events and career opportunities bluepearl is committed to a diverse work environment in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity we are an equal opportunity employer and you will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color national origin religion creed sex age disability genetic information marital status citizenship status sexual orientation or gender identity or expression protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law if you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability it is available upon request the company is pleased to provide such assistance and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request we are an equal opportunity employer and a drug free workplace

hospital you will use your technical skills on a daily basis within state practice acts and as outlined in the navta guidelines for veterinary assistant skills and duties other responsibilities include  helping maintain the flow of patients   communicating with the veterinarian and vet techs   carrying out or setting up procedures that do not require veterinarian or vet tech assistance   adhering to hospital standards that keep pets safe and the treatment areas exam rooms and labs clean and organized   educating clients about our optimum wellness plans® and the importance of preventive care   mentoring other members of the hospital team commitment beyond qualifications every associate including the vet assistant has an important contribution to make to the veterinary team we’re looking for vet assistants who are dedicated to their work have a positive attitude and use our five principles  quality responsibility mutuality efficiency and freedom – as their guide in addition our vet assistants are  action oriented   customer focused   good listeners   effective communicators caring for those who care benefits for a banfield veterinary assistant when it comes to benefits we support your personal wellness and professional development we offer a wide range of perks and programs that help you take care of yourself and your family—including your pets   personal health savings and wellness benefits every team member needs to be appreciated all vet assistants receive a generous benefits package including 401 k participation paid time off and optimum wellness plans for your pets in addition medical vision dental life and disability insurance is offered to associates based on eligibility   potential as big as your passion whether you’re a new vet assistant have been working for years or are changing careers we’ll support your professional growth with  performance development plans designed to help you reach your established careers goals  relevant learning opportunities   networking events   ways to offer your skills to your community a support structure that helps you thrive we’ve created a one of a kind leadership structure throughout our practice that includes support from our corporate headquarters the field and hospital level together we are a team making a real impact on pet health care in hospitals communities and the field of veterinary medicine   start your banfield career as a veterinary assistant learn more about the impact you can make as part of a banfield hospital team and see how we support the wellness of our job description we are seeking an experienced veterinary assistant to join our team the successful candidate will be a believer in the possibilities of high quality veterinary medicine and patient care—with the expertise and technical know how to make them happen  duties will include in this position you will be supporting our doctors and technician team by creating a positive low stress atmosphere for our clients and patients maintaining medical records preparing surgical suite and surgical patients filling prescriptions performing laboratory work and diagnostic imaging providing compassionate care and a home away from home for boarded and hospitalized pets at vca your passion for medicine and compassion for pets and people is matched with a commitment to your professional growth you will enjoy exposure to a diverse and stimulating caseload employ the most advanced imaging and monitoring tools and tap into the expertise of more than 4 500 doctors including 600 boarded specialists you will sharpen your skills—and even learn some new techniques—and explore career options that only vca can offer such as continuing education transfer specialization and leadership opportunities

veterinary technician banfield aspires to be a practice where as a team we make a positive impact on pet health care in hospitals communities and the field of veterinary medicine and we believe hiring people with diverse perspectives ideas and cultures permits us to deliver to the highest quality of preventive care  as a banfield veterinary technician you will work alongside pet health care industry experts to make a difference in the lives of the pets and clients we serve with the chance to utilize your veterinary knowledge communication skills and love for pets this role will afford you the opportunity to define a clear career path for continued growth and learning  responsibilities support veterinarians to ensure quality veterinary care advocate for pets and educate clients with each hospital function assist veterinarians and the medical team to maximize productivity and maintain positive patient flow assist with surgeries and procedures in accordance with your states veterinary practice act outlined for credentialed veterinary technicians communicate with clients about individualized pet health concerns and offer guidance on optimum wellness plan® options medications and additional treatments assist in maintaining relevant comprehensive medical records with the support of practice systems including banfield’s database petware designed to obtain data for population research  obtain relevant health history and information from clients and maintain medical charts use safe restraining techniques follow standard protocols and sustain clean sterile organized treatment areas exam rooms and labs be willing to guide mentor and support fellow team members  requirements veterinary technician certification or licensure cvt rvt lvt or lvmt  cb commitment beyond qualifications being a veterinary technician requires much more than avma certified credentials it means bringing your talents skills dedication and a desire for developing alongside your peers but most importantly it means showing up each day with a passion for pets and working with others who believe preventive care is the key to helping pets achieve long and healthy lives  as we do with all our associates we look to our vet techs to adopt our five principles — quality responsibility mutuality efficiency and freedom and while your on paper qualifications are of course important we actively seek out vet techs who thrive on delivering outstanding client and pet experiences  your wellbeing matters  we know that your real passion for pet well being is why you chose this profession at banfield we believe it is just as important to support the well being of those who devote their lives to this cause through our extensive network and support structure banfield offers a wide array of benefits and programs empowering you to focus on yourself and your family as you care for pets and clients as a banfield vet tech we want you to take full advantage of work and play through competitive salary with paid time off medical dental vision and prescription drug benefits for you and eligible dependents automatic enrollment in 401 k savings plan after 60 days of employment health savings account with annual practice paid funding of 750 to supplement health care expenses automatic enrollment in 100 practice paid short and long term disability after 60 days of employment – includes maternity leave optimum wellness plans owps for up to three pets a variety of discounts including mars petsmart royal canin fitness cellular and so much more potential as big as your passion we are committed to helping you grow as a vet tech by providing whether you are a newly certified or an experienced vet tech a job at banfield opens the door to exploring the next best move in your career performance development plans pdp designed to help you define and achieve your career goals practice paid continuing education opportunities along with the opportunity to attend partner conferences free membership to navta practice paid subscription to vetfolio and a 50 discount for vetgirl opportunities to lend your skills to the local communities where you live and serve ability to grow into leadership roles at the field and practice level support that helps you thrive we’ve created a structure that includes leadership and support at the hospital level in the field and at our headquarters all with one goal in mind helping you deliver quality care for all pets  commitment to community wellness through volunteering efforts and our programs designed to benefit local shelters and rescues we strengthen the pet human connections in our communities discover how we support the wellbeing of our people and profession through the mars volunteer program mvp  so what are you waiting for? make your move and apply today banfield pet hospital® strongly supports and values the uniqueness of all individuals and promotes a work environment where diversity is embraced banfield pet hospital is an equal opportunity employer all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race religion color national origin sex sexual orientation gender identity age genetic information or protected veteran status if you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation please let us know banfield pet hospital follows all applicable federal state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every banfield location

job_description: los angeles area veterinary hospital seeking a temporary full time receptionist approximately 35 hours  week for their busy practice hours to be filled are monday thursday 8 am  5 pm receptionist must have previous experience working in veterinary hospital at least 1 3 years cornerstone software knowledge preferred position will be temporary 3 4 months to cover another receptionist on maternity leave pay based on experience interested candidates should call 310 838 9300 or email s gebauervetstaff com for immediate consideration

because we’re obsessed with the health of pets we offer a variety of vet services to meet the needs of our customers which means a wealth of career opportunities whether you’re a licensed veterinarian or a veterinarian support professional located inside petco stores our vetco wellness centers offer professional expertise for common pet health problems  our vetco vaccination clinics offer a variety of preventive care services for healthy dogs and cats inside petco and unleashed by petco retail stores across the us rather than having a permanent presence these clinics function like pop ups inside petco stores our crew and veterinarian arrive at the store with the equipment vaccines medications and everything else they need to take care of the pets they see  position purpose as a vetco veterinary assistant you will meet your veterinary team at our local dispatch office then travel to your assigned petco clinic locations for the day at the clinics your team of veterinary assistants will greet the pet parents and recommend the veterinary services that will best protect their pets the veterinary assistant will assist the veterinarian so the services can be administered and thank the pet parent for protecting their pet essential job functionsthe incumbent must be able to perform all of the following duties and responsibilities with or without a reasonable accommodation must love dogs and cats  and people too team player who thrives on supporting the team in every way make educated recommendations to our clients and providing exceptional customer service works hard and has fun doing it eager to learn ability to work in changing environments traveling throughout our market responsible and accountable individuals a can do attitude education experience available to work on saturdays and sundays comfortable with dogs and cats of all breeds and sizes ability to appropriately  safely restrain when necessary fractious pets able to lift 50 lbs and stand for long periods of time strong product knowledge including heartworm preventatives flea preventatives  vaccines strong knowledge of intestinal parasites prevention  heartworm prevention  heartworm disease in both cats  dogs detail oriented with the ability to think clearly and multitask in a busy environment ability to perform basic math accurately have strong client education  communication skills bi lingual skills preferred but not required a can do attitude and a team player no minimum

job description join our family are you looking to be a part of a hospital team that feels like family while having the support and resources to push your career forward? if so we would love to connect with you vca indian land animal hospital is seeking a veterinary assistant to join our one of a kind 4 doctor gp practice our hospital has been serving the fort mill indian land community for over 12 years we believe in providing the best possible care to our patients our tight knit community is a great place to call home many of us can be found at local breweries restaurants and summer festivals at vca indian land animal hospital you can be the veterinary assistant you have always wanted to be we have a unique culture in our hospital that values each person’s individual skill and personality there’s something special about you and we are excited to learn more among the reasons to consider joining vca are vca hospitals are former private practices that retain the spirit that made them successful access to the people and financial resources of a large veterinary community network of 4 500 doctors including more than 600 specialists largest provider of private practice internships and residencies in the u s woof university offering abundant ce for doctors and technicians robust clinical studies program opportunities to give back through strong shelter partnerships and vca charities vca adds value to your compensation package with the following competitive wage medical dental  vision insurance opportunity to teach and mentor 401 k life and long term disability insurance

because we’re obsessed with the health of pets we offer a variety of vet services to meet the needs of our customers which means a wealth of career opportunities whether you’re a licensed veterinarian or a veterinarian support professional located inside petco stores our vetco wellness centers offer professional expertise for common pet health problems  our vetco vaccination clinics offer a variety of preventive care services for healthy dogs and cats inside petco and unleashed by petco retail stores across the us rather than having a permanent presence these clinics function like pop ups inside petco stores our crew and veterinarian arrive at the store with the equipment vaccines medications and everything else they need to take care of the pets they see   as a vetco veterinary assistant you will meet your veterinary team at our local dispatch office then travel to your assigned petco clinic locations for the day at the clinics your team of veterinary assistants will greet the pet parents and recommend the veterinary services that will best protect their pets the veterinary assistant will assist the veterinarian so the services can be administered and thank the pet parent for protecting their pet w   no minimum

bluepearl veterinary partners in southfield mi is now hiring a motivated and experienced veterinary assistant to join our fast paced emergency department this is a full time opportunity typical shifts are 2pm 12am or 3pm 1am typically four 10 hour shifts or five 8 hour shifts per week *generous shift differential provided for night and weekend hours worked*  are you passionate about working with and helping animals?  do you crave a dynamic and rewarding work environment?  are you self driven dependable and knowledgeable veterinary care?  would you consider yourself a team player? if you
